prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples,"Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

response:
```
# Load necessary libraries
library(readxl)
library(dplyr)
library(DESeq2)
library(ggplot2)

# Read the count table
count_table <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")

# Read the annotation data
annotation_data <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv")

# Transpose the count table and set row names as gene names
count_table <- t(count_table[,-1])
rownames(count_table) <- count_table[,1]

# Remove the gene names column from count table
count_table <- count_table[,-1]

# Set the row names of annotation data as sample ids
rownames(annotation_data) <- annotation_data[,1]

# Remove the sample ids column from annotation data
annotation_data <- annotation_data[,-1]

# Create a DESeqDataSet object
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = count_table,
                              colData = annotation_data,
                              design = ~ group)

# Perform differential expression analysis
dds <- DESeq(dds)

# Get the results
res <- results(dds)

# Adjust p-values for multiple testing using the Benjamini-Hochberg method
res <- data.frame(res, padj = p.adjust(res$pvalue, method = "BH"))

# Filter the results based on adjusted p-values
significant_genes <- res[res$padj < 0.05, ]

# Get genes specific for each group
group_genes <- list()
for (group_name in unique(annotation_data$group)) {
  group_ids <- annotation_data$group == group_name
  group_genes[[group_name]] <- rownames(significant_genes)[group_ids]
}

# Create a new count table with only group-specific genes
group_count_table <- count_table[group_genes$group1, ]

# Perform PCA on the group-specific count table
pca <- prcomp(t(group_count_table), scale = TRUE)

# Get PC scores
pc_scores <- data.frame(pca$x)
pc_scores$group <- annotation_data$group

# Plot PCA colored by group variable
ggplot(pc_scores, aes(x = PC1, y = PC2, color = group)) +
  geom_point() +
  labs(x = "PC1", y = "PC2", color = "Group")
